org.matrix.androidsdk.data

Class EventTimeline

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.matrix.androidsdk.data.EventTimeline

  • public class EventTimeline
extends Object
    A `EventTimeline` instance represents a contiguous sequence of events in a room. There are two kinds of timeline: - live timelines: they receive live events from the events stream. You can paginate backwards but not forwards. All (live or backwards) events they receive are stored in the store of the current MXSession. - past timelines: they start in the past from an `initialEventId`. They are filled with events on calls of [MXEventTimeline paginate] in backwards or forwards direction. Events are stored in a in-memory store (MXMemoryStore).

      • mBackwardTopToken

        private String mBackwardTopToken
        the server provides a token even for the first room message (which should never change it is the creator message). so requestHistory always triggers a remote request which returns an empty json. try to avoid such behaviour

                                  EventTimeline.Direction direction)

        Parameters:

        direction - the direction; ie. forwards for live state, backwards for back state

      • backPaginate

        public boolean backPaginate(int eventCount,
                            ApiCallback<Integer> callback)
        Request older messages. They will come down the onBackEvent callback.
        Parameters:
        eventCount - number of events we want to retrieve
        callback - callback to implement to be informed that the pagination request has been completed. Can be null.
        Returns:
        true if request starts

      • backPaginate

        public boolean backPaginate(int eventCount,
                            boolean useCachedOnly,
                            ApiCallback<Integer> callback)
        Request older messages. They will come down the onBackEvent callback.
        Parameters:
        eventCount - number of events we want to retrieve
        useCachedOnly - to use the cached events list only (i.e no request will be triggered)
        callback - callback to implement to be informed that the pagination request has been completed. Can be null.
        Returns:
        true if request starts

      • forwardPaginate

        public boolean forwardPaginate(ApiCallback<Integer> callback)
        Request older messages. They will come down the onBackEvent callback.
        Parameters:
        callback - callback to implement to be informed that the pagination request has been completed. Can be null.
        Returns:
        true if request starts

        Returns:

      • cancelPaginationRequest

      • resetPaginationAroundInitialEvent

        public void resetPaginationAroundInitialEvent(int limit,
                                              ApiCallback<Void> callback)
        Reset the pagination timelime and start loading the context around its `initialEventId`. The retrieved (backwards and forwards) events will be sent to registered listeners.
        Parameters:
        limit - the maximum number of messages to get around the initial event.
        callback - the operation callback
